728259f-a.text:
Yellowstone Avenue (background, not shown) adjoining the S.W. corner of Darmouth Street (right, partially seen), showing the Abraham Boerum house in the rear of the Abraham Furman house. One Miller was the owner in 1896. The house was razed by fire
in 1923.
1922
Eugene L. Armrbuster Collection
728259f-a.folder: Yellowstone Boulevard & Dartmouth Street, Queens, NY

728270f-b.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard (formerly white Pot Road), east side, between Dartmouth and Clyde Streets, showing in 4 views the Abraham Furman farmhouse. The homestead of Caspar Springstein, who settled here about 1700 was opposite the Furman property on the west side of the Boulevard. The buildings seen on the west side of White Pot Road at about Burns Street are no longer in existent in 1925. They were the property of David Springstein in 1909. See other views.
1922
Views 1,2,3 and 4.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
728270f-b.folder: Yellowstone Boulevard & Dartmouth Street, Queens, NY

728269f-b.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard, east side, between Dartmouth and Clyde Streets. The Boulevard will, when constructed, pass through the foreground. This set of 4 views of the Abraham Furman farmhouse shows the south and east sides. lIt is also said to be the Springsteen homestead. See other views.
July 1923
Views 2,3&4 March 1923
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

728268f-b.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard (formerly White Pot Road), east side, between Dartmouth and Clyde Streets, showing in two views the Abraham Furman farmhouse. In the background of both these views is seen the embarkment of the Long Island Railroad. See other views for more data.
Feb. 1924
Views l and 2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

728267f-a.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard ( Cars thereon in background ) east side between Dartmouth and Clyde Streets, showing inthe center of the view at about the S.E. corner of Dartmouth Street and the aforementioned Boulevard the Abram Furman house. This view is taken from Sixty-seventh Avenue and Clyde Street, and views south east taking in the Area between Exeter and Clyde Streets. See other views .
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
728267f-a.folder: Yellowstone Boulevard & Dartmouth Street, Queens, NY

728260f-b.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard at the S.E. corner of Darthmouth SStreet, showing two views of the Abraham Furmman house erected about 1680. Some have it that it was erected about 1700. It was demolished in 1935.
About 1928
Views 1 and 2
Arthur White
